Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is black in section, exterior covered with a self-slip and with remains of twelve lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393207) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393207)
